Big data and Ai in enterprise

Introduction to Big Data:

Big Data refers to the vast amount of data generated from various sources, which are the challenges to process through traditional methods due to the 3 Vs: Volume, Velocity and Variety. Since the 2000s, the growth in data and advancements in Cloud Computing, Data Lakes, and Distributed Systems have made it possible to store, process, and analyze Big Data efficiently.

How are AI and Big Data working together to transform the way businesses make decisions, optimize resources, and enhance customer experiences across different industries?

Services - United Parcel Service Logo United States Postal Service UPS

Data and AI at UPS:

ORIAN (On-Road integrated Optimization and Navigation)

Data from UPS vehicles such as speed, direction, braking and drive train performance.

This data is used to configure a driver’s route, pickups, and drop-offs in real time.

UPS started developing ORIAN in 2003 with the goal of layering predictive algorithms on top of the vehicle tracking systems that they had at the time

ORIAN provides an optimize route for each of UPS’ 55,000 U.S. drivers based on the packages to be picked up and delivered on that day.

Data and AI at UnitedHealth Care:

Using unstructured data such as recorded voices from calls.

In the past the calls were only recorded for complaint reasons now they can get information from these calls by converting the voice into text using “natural language processing” software

Power of using Big Data and AI

Te use of Big Data and AI would allow for data driven decisions that will help drive business Success in the future. By optimizing resource Allocation and further understanding of Customer needs.
